description:
This module is an introduction to creative

writing. Weekly classes offer students

structures and stimuli to discover and develop

their creativity. The module provides a large

practical component, aimed at helping students

generate and develop a portfolio of work across

the strands of fiction, poetry and script writing.

Students will explore aspects of character,

storyline, dialogue, structure, narrative voice,

tension, style, endings and point-of-view in

writing. Over the semester, students will learn

various techniques relevant to their writing,

share their ideas and work-in-progress, explore

different approaches through writing exercises,

and discuss working practice.
title: Introduction to Creative Writing
prerequisite:
EL1101E or EN1101E or TS1101E or GEK1011 or GEK1000 or GEM1003. This
module is selective, and enrolment is by application.
